meta.title: Kita Gagal - Failure Enthusiast Community
meta.description: Join the community of failed entrepreneurs. Celebrate bankruptcy, learn from mistakes, and laugh at losses.
meta.keywords: startup failure, failure community, bankrupt business, learn from failure, funny motivation

hero.subtitle: Success is boring. Failure teaches us the meaning of survival, fixing life's bugs, and laughing at the red glowing error logs.

marquee.text: 404 Not Found • Server Error 500 • Build Failed • Runtime Error • Stack Overflow • Undefined is not a function •

philosophy.desc: At "Kita Gagal", we believe every error code is an unfinished poem. Every abandoned project is a monument of learning. We don't hide our stupidity; we show it off.
philosophy.image_alt: Frustrated developer in front of a laptop
philosophy.image_caption: "I tried to fix one bug, and gave birth to ten new ones. Beautiful."

timeline.title: Our Life Cycle
timeline.subtitle: The process we repeat every day without remorse.
timeline.step1_desc: Got a brilliant idea at 2 AM, started coding immediately without documentation.
timeline.step2_desc: Why does the code run but the result is wrong? Even Copilot gave up.
timeline.step3_desc: Delete repo, uninstall VS Code, contemplate in the corner, then start again.

gallery.title: Error Gallery
gallery.subtitle: Beauty in visual imperfection.
gallery.img2_alt: Laptop with blue screen or error

testimonials.title: Words from Those Who Mistakenly Donated
testimonials.subtitle: Generous souls who already transferred and cannot refund.
testimonials.person1_quote: I donated out of pity, not belief. Hope it buys sachet coffee, not to rent an AWS server you forgot to turn off.
testimonials.person2_quote: At least donating here is clear: to celebrate failure. More transparent than my old startup's financial report.
testimonials.person3_quote: Leftover snack money. I donate so you guys stay spirited in failing, so I have company.

cta.title_highlight: Or at least fail with style.
cta.desc: Your donation will be used to buy quality coffee, noisier mechanical keyboards, and coding course subscriptions that we never finish.

footer.desc: A community of developers proud of every error, typo, and logic fallacy we create.
